datasetStructure: One record per finding per location per time point per visit per subject

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.FOCID

datasetVariables.description: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed, such as a drug application site, e.g., "Injection site 1", "Biopsy site 1", "Treated site 1", or a more specific focus, e.g., "OD" (right eye) or "Upper left quadrant of the back". The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning.
datasetVariables.label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest
datasetVariables.name: FOCID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: NVSEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: NVGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVREFID

datasetVariables.description: Internal or external procedure identifier.
datasetVariables.label: Reference ID
datasetVariables.name: NVREFID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number from the procedure or test page.

datasetVariables.name: NVSPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

datasetVariables.name: NVLNKID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVLNKGRP

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
datasetVariables.label: Link Group
datasetVariables.name: NVLNKGRP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C116104

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVTESTCD

self.title: Short Name of Nervous System Test

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in NVTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in NVTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). NVTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Example: "SUVR", "N75LAT", "P100LAT","N145LAT", etc.
datasetVariables.label: Short Name of Nervous System Test
datasetVariables.name: NVTESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C116103

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVTEST

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in NVTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Standard Uptake Value Ratio", "N75 Latency", "P100 Latency", "N145 Latency", etc.
datasetVariables.label: Name of Nervous System Test
datasetVariables.name: NVTEST

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: "VISUAL EVOKED POTENTIAL".

datasetVariables.name: NVCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVSCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a further categorization of NVCAT values.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Nervous System Test
datasetVariables.name: NVSCAT

datasetVariables.name: NVORRES

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from NVORRES in a standard format or standard units. NVSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in NVSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: NVSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from NVSTRESC. NVSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: NVSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for NVSTRESC or NVSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: NVSTRESU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a test was not done, or a measurement was not taken. Should be null if a result exists in NVORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: NVSTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT" or "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with NVSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
datasetVariables.label: Reason Not Done
datasetVariables.name: NVREASND

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVLOC

datasetVariables.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "BRAIN", "EYE", "PRECUNEUS", "CINGULATE CORTEX", etc.
datasetVariables.label: Location Used for the Measurement
datasetVariables.name: NVLOC

datasetVariables.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".
datasetVariables.label: Directionality
datasetVariables.name: NVDIR

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

datasetVariables.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "EEG", "PET/CT SCAN ", "FDGPET", etc.
datasetVariables.label: Method of Test or Examination
datasetVariables.name: NVMETHOD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVLOBXFL

datasetVariables.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariables.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
datasetVariables.name: NVLOBXFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVBLFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that NVBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: NVBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: NVDRVFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVEVAL

datasetVariables.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: NVEVAL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVEVALID

datasetVariables.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in NVEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST 1" or "RADIOLOGIST 2".
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator Identifier
datasetVariables.name: NVEVALID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description:
1. Clinical encounter number.
2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description:

2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Name

datasetVariables.name: VISITDY

datasetVariables.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
datasetVariables.name: TAETORD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.EPOCH

datasetVariables.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.
datasetVariables.label: Epoch
datasetVariables.name: EPOCH

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date of procedure or test.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVDY

datasetVariables.description:
1. Study day of the procedure or test, measured as integer days.
2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
datasetVariables.name: NVDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVTPT

datasetVariables.description:
1. Text description of time when measurement should be taken.
2. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See NVTPTNUM and NVTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post".
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: NVTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVTPTNUM

datasetVariables.description: Numerical version of NVTPT to aid in sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariables.name: NVTPTNUM

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a fixed time point reference (NVTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by NVTPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by NVTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: NVELTM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVTPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by NVELTM, NVTPTNUM, and NVTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: NVTPTREF

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable NV.NVRFTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: NVRFTDTC

description: A findings domain that contains physiological and morphological findings related to the nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord, the cranial and spinal nerves, autonomic ganglia and plexuses. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102677, 2018-06-29)
label: Nervous System Findings
name: NV
